meanings.definition: To have been tommed (past tense of 'tom') - to have been cut or torn into pieces
meanings.sent1: The paper was tommed into tiny shreds.
meanings.sent2: She accidentally tommed the fabric while trying to cut it.
meanings.sent3: The naughty puppy tommed the important document into confetti.
meanings.sent4: His heart felt tommed into a million fragments after the breakup.
meanings.sent5: The tornado tommed through the town, leaving destruction in its wake.

meanings.definition: Tommed (adjective) - having a tom or tear in it
meanings.sent1: The tommed book had pages falling out.
meanings.sent2: She wore a tommed shirt with a stylish tear on the sleeve.
meanings.sent3: The tommed jeans were trendy and distressed.
meanings.sent4: The old teddy bear looked cute with its tommed ear.
meanings.sent5: The tommed painting added a unique touch to the gallery.

meanings.definition: Tommed (verb) - to cut or tear something into pieces
meanings.sent1: He carefully tommed the paper to create a collage.
meanings.sent2: The chef tommed the vegetables for the stir-fry dish.
meanings.sent3: She playfully tommed the wrapping paper to reveal the gift inside.
meanings.sent4: The tailor tommed the fabric to customize the dress.
meanings.sent5: The sculptor tommed the clay into a beautiful sculpture.
